intro: Phacelia quickii, commonly known as quick's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Phacelia quickii is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
